title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that diminishing marginal returns begin after the third worker and/or does not explain that the marginal product (MP) of the fourth worker (30) was less than the MP of the third worker (60).
The response states that diminishing marginal returns begin after the third worker and explains that the marginal product (MP) of the fourth worker (30) was less than the MP of the third worker (60).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the marginal revenue product of the fifth worker as $80 and/or does not show the work.

MRP = P×MP = $4×20 = $80 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D24@

The response calculates the marginal revenue product of the fifth worker as $80 and shows the work.

MRP = P×MP = $4×20 = $80 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D24@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that 4 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 4th worker ($120) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($90), but the MRP of the 5th worker ($80) is less than the MRC ($90).

The response states that 4 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and explains that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 4th worker ($120) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($90), but the MRP of the 5th worker ($80) is less than the MRC ($90).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the wage rate the firm will pay will increase and explains that an increase in the price of office software will result in an increase in the demand for workers because office software and workers are substitutes in providing tax advisory services. An increase in the demand for workers will increase the market wage and therefore increase the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

· States that the demand curve for administrative assistants by Jose’s Tax Office will stay the same in the short run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP), which is the price of the service times the marginal product, and in the short run there is no change in the price of the service or the marginal product.

Or states that the demand curve for administrative assistants by Jose’s Tax Office will increase in the long run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP) which is the price of the product times the marginal product, and an increase in the price of an input will decrease the supply of tax advisory services in the market, which will increase the market price of services, and therefore will increase the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the wage rate the firm will pay will increase and explains that an increase in the price of office software will result in an increase in the demand for workers because office software and workers are substitutes in providing tax advisory services. An increase in the demand for workers will increase the market wage and therefore increase the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

· States that the demand curve for administrative assistants by Jose’s Tax Office will stay the same in the short run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP), which is the price of the service times the marginal product, and in the short run there is no change in the price of the service or the marginal product.

Or states that the demand curve for administrative assistants by Jose’s Tax Office will increase in the long run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP) which is the price of the product times the marginal product, and an increase in the price of an input will decrease the supply of tax advisory services in the market, which will increase the market price of services, and therefore will increase the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the wage rate the firm will pay will increase and explains that an increase in the price of office software will result in an increase in the demand for workers because office software and workers are substitutes in providing tax advisory services. An increase in the demand for workers will increase the market wage and therefore increase the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

· States that the demand curve for administrative assistants by Jose’s Tax Office will stay the same in the short run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP), which is the price of the service times the marginal product, and in the short run there is no change in the price of the service or the marginal product.

Or states that the demand curve for administrative assistants by Jose’s Tax Office will increase in the long run and explains that the firm’s demand curve for labor is the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP) which is the price of the product times the marginal product, and an increase in the price of an input will decrease the supply of tax advisory services in the market, which will increase the market price of services, and therefore will increase the marginal revenue product for every unit of labor.
